methodology: Each sport coded on 6 dimensions (0-10 scales or categorical) to test as predictors of linguistic effect patterns

contact_level.hypothesis: Higher contact predicts stronger phonetic harshness effects

team_structure.description: Team vs individual and team size if applicable
team_structure.hypothesis: Larger teams predict stronger name brevity effects (announcer constraints)

endurance_vs_explosive.description: Duration and intensity pattern of effort
endurance_vs_explosive.hypothesis: Explosive sports require simpler names for rapid recognition

precision_vs_power.hypothesis: Precision sports value memorability over harshness

action_speed.description: Pace of play and frequency of events
action_speed.hypothesis: Faster sports require more memorable names for fan engagement

announcer_repetition.description: Frequency of name mentions during broadcast
announcer_repetition.hypothesis: Higher repetition amplifies all name effects

soccer.contact_rationale: Moderate physical contact, some collisions but not primary focus
soccer.endurance_rationale: 90 minute matches with continuous running, some sprints
soccer.precision_rationale: Balance of technical skill and physical attributes
soccer.announcer_rationale: Names constantly called during play-by-play, especially goalscorers
soccer.predicted_name_pattern: Short, memorable names dominate. Harsh phonetics moderate effect.

tennis.endurance_rationale: Matches vary 1-5 hours, mix of explosive shots and sustained rallies
tennis.precision_rationale: Highly technical sport, placement more important than power
tennis.action_speed_rationale: Moderate pace, points interspersed with breaks
tennis.announcer_rationale: Individual sport, name called before every point
tennis.predicted_name_pattern: Memorability critical. Soft phonetics predicted for precision.

boxing_mma.contact_rationale: Pure combat sport, maximum physical contact and violence
boxing_mma.endurance_rationale: Short explosive bursts (3-15 min rounds), some cardio element
boxing_mma.precision_rationale: Power and aggression dominate, though technique matters
boxing_mma.announcer_rationale: Names constantly repeated during and between rounds
boxing_mma.predicted_name_pattern: MAXIMUM harsh phonetics effect expected. Short, aggressive-sounding names.

baseball.contact_rationale: Minimal contact except occasional collisions at bases
baseball.endurance_rationale: Explosive batting/throwing, long games but low continuous exertion
baseball.precision_rationale: Highly technical: pitching control, batting eye critical
baseball.action_speed_rationale: Slow pace, discrete events separated by time
baseball.announcer_rationale: Every batter announced, frequent name mentions
baseball.predicted_name_pattern: Length less critical due to slow pace. Memorability matters.

basketball.contact_rationale: Significant physical contact, especially in paint, but not combat
basketball.endurance_rationale: Continuous running up and down court, explosive jumps
basketball.precision_rationale: Balance of athleticism and shooting precision
basketball.announcer_rationale: Rapid-fire name calling during fast breaks and scores
basketball.predicted_name_pattern: Short names advantage due to pace. Moderate harshness effect.

football.contact_rationale: High-impact collisions on every play, one step below combat
football.endurance_rationale: Pure explosive power in 4-6 second bursts
football.precision_rationale: Power-dominated sport, though QB passing requires precision
football.action_speed_rationale: Discrete plays with breaks between, but plays are explosive
football.announcer_rationale: Names called frequently, especially skill position players
football.predicted_name_pattern: Strong harsh phonetics effect expected. Short, powerful names.

cricket.endurance_rationale: Test matches are endurance (5 days), but individual actions explosive
cricket.precision_rationale: Batting technique and bowling precision critical
cricket.action_speed_rationale: Very slow pace, especially test cricket
cricket.announcer_rationale: Batsmen and bowlers named frequently during play
cricket.predicted_name_pattern: Length less critical. Precision-associated names predicted.

H1_contact_harshness.interpretation: Each point increase in contact level predicts 3% stronger harshness effect

H2_team_size_length.interpretation: Larger teams show stronger advantage for short names (announcer brevity)

H3_endurance_complexity.hypothesis: endurance_score predicts tolerance for complex names
H3_endurance_complexity.interpretation: Endurance sports allow more complex names (less time pressure)

H4_precision_memorability.expected_pattern: High precision sports prioritize memorability over harshness

H5_speed_simplicity.interpretation: Faster sports require simpler, more quickly processable names

H6_announcer_amplification.expected_pattern: Interaction term: repetition × effect strengthens correlations
H6_announcer_amplification.interpretation: High-repetition sports show stronger effects overall

control_variables.era: Some sports have different eras (pre-analytics vs analytics), control for year
control_variables.position: Within-sport position effects (QB vs linebacker different from WR)
control_variables.nationality: Cultural name differences, include as covariate
control_variables.career_length: Survivorship bias - longer careers may correlate with everything

analysis_plan.step_1: Within-sport correlations (7 sports × 15 linguistic features = 105 correlation tests)
analysis_plan.step_2: Extract effect sizes (r-values) for each linguistic feature per sport
analysis_plan.step_3: Meta-regression: sport characteristics predict effect sizes (n=7 sports)
analysis_plan.step_5: Generate predictions for untested sports based on characteristics
